summary: Today’s PaymentsDive recap: 8 new stories, with focus on fraud/security, regulation.

articles.title: PayPal, Rainforest join forces
articles.description: The digital payments pioneer and software services firm are locking arms to simplify embedded payments for merchants.

articles.title: Block job cuts prompt CFO AI questions
articles.description: As one of technology’s largest AI-driven job cuts of the year takes shape, CFO Alliance roundtables show finance leaders discussing operating design and execution capacity before resizing teams.

articles.title: Marqeta flags Cash App hit
articles.description: Marqeta’s largest customer is realizing some better pricing from contract changes related to Cash App’s debit cards.

articles.title: Block swaps 4,000 workers for AI
articles.description: CEO Jack Dorsey told investors Thursday that Block’s headcount will drop about 40% as it leans on artificial intelligence for efficiencies.

articles.title: Debit card fraud losses rise
articles.description: Fraud loss rates for debit cardholders have climbed in recent years, according to a Federal Reserve analysis published this week.

articles.title: Fiserv appoints new executives
articles.description: The payment processor added two chief revenue officers and a business development executive as it seeks to raise sales figures.

articles.title: Meta dips a toe back into crypto
articles.description: The social media giant is exploring the use of stablecoin payments in its app ecosystem, years after its Diem digital currency experiment imploded.

articles.title: FIS caters to banks’ AI appetite
articles.description: Fidelity National Information Services views artificial intelligence as a “strategic accelerant” to its business, said CEO Stephanie Ferris, who discounted risks.
